channel.title: Illegal start of expression!

item.title: Illegal start of expression!
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“relmitos, post:9, topic:551471”]You’re telling it to draw some text, but not where to write it.
Look at aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, "XP:", y+21, x-88);
then decide where you want the counter relative to that.

Or even better,

Don’t have to muck around with finding the correct position.[/quote]

I got it figured out thank you! for the help but for some odd reason nothing showed up the only reason i was looking into this was because in game i was able to do ::xp and it would say “your xp drops has been removed” i guess my real question is how am i to re-enable the xp drops…

Read full topic

item.title: Illegal start of expression!
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

You’re telling it to draw some text, but not where to write it.
Look at aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, "XP:", y+21, x-88);
then decide where you want the counter relative to that.

Or even better,

Don’t have to muck around with finding the correct position.

Read full topic

item.title: Illegal start of expression!
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“relmitos, post:7, topic:551471”]aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, Integer.toString(xpCounter));
The correct arguments are int,string,int,int, needs x&y values.

Integer math, thus (expAdded == 0), also the semicolumn doesnt belong there, thats how you fix your next compiling error.[/quote]

Okay i understand it has to be int, string, int int … But exactly how is that placed into my coding im adding xp counter/tracker however you go about saying it.

Read full topic

item.title: Illegal start of expression!
item.dc:creator: @relmitos relmitos
item.description:
@relmitos wrote:

The correct arguments are int,string,int,int,  needs x&y values.

[code] if (expAdded = 0); { [/code]
Integer math, thus (expAdded == 0), also the semicolumn doesnt belong there, thats how you fix your next compiling error.

The correct arguments are int,string,int,int, needs x&y values.

Integer math, thus (expAdded == 0), also the semicolumn doesnt belong there, thats how you fix your next compiling error.

Read full topic

item.title: Illegal start of expression!
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

tL:

Hmm… I Think You Need Mod Taharok’s Perfect Compiler

What do you mean lol, perfect compiler and now that’s fixed i’m getting this.

private void drawCounterOnScreen() {
int x = 520;
int y = 47;
counter[2].drawSprite(x-100, y+8);
int i = aTextDrawingArea_1271.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(xpCounter));
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, “XP:”, y+21, x-88);
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, Integer.toString(xpCounter));
if (expAdded = 0); {
i = smallText.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”);
smallText.drawText(0xff9933, Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”, y+21+18+xpAddedPos, x-12-i);
xpAddedPos += 2;
if (xpAddedPos >= 50) {
xpAddedPos = 0;
expAdded = 0;
}
}
}

Read full topic

item.title: Illegal start of expression!
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

[quote=“Zymus, post:2, topic:551471”]You have a comma:
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, Integer.toString(xpCounter),

And a semicolon:
if (expAdded = 0);

you need to remove.[/quote]

Okay i got this now, i fixed it down to 1 error.

private void drawCounterOnScreen() {
int x = 520;
int y = 47;
counter[2].drawSprite(x-100, y+8);
int i = aTextDrawingArea_1271.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(xpCounter));
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, “XP:”, y+21, x-88);
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, Integer.toString(xpCounter);
if (expAdded = 0); {
i = smallText.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”);
smallText.drawText(0xff9933, Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”, y+21+18+xpAddedPos, x-12-i);
xpAddedPos += 2;
if (xpAddedPos >= 50) {
xpAddedPos = 0;
expAdded = 0;
}
}
}

item.title: Illegal start of expression!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

You have a comma:
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, Integer.toString(xpCounter),

And a semicolon:
if (expAdded = 0);

you need to remove.

Read full topic

item.title: Illegal start of expression!
item.dc:creator: @tank_nation tank nation
item.description:
@tank_nation wrote:

Here’s my code, not sure whats going on here. I know where the error is just don’t understand how to fix!

private void drawCounterOnScreen() {
int x = 520;
int y = 47;
counter[2].drawSprite(x-100, y+8);
int i = aTextDrawingArea_1271.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(xpCounter));
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, “XP:”, y+21, x-88);
aTextDrawingArea_1271.drawText(0xffffff, Integer.toString(xpCounter),
if (expAdded = 0); {
i = smallText.getTextWidth(Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”);
smallText.drawText(0xff9933, Integer.toString(expAdded)+“xp”, y+21+18+xpAddedPos, x-12-i);
xpAddedPos += 2;
if (xpAddedPos >= 50) {
xpAddedPos = 0;
expAdded = 0;
}
}
}
